125131211.content:
You hover over your school to look for the best entry point. One of the double doors near the cafeteria would be best, naturally, but it would take a while to get through even that. The logistics of being huge are quite complicated, although you are adjusting, and you think back on how lucky you were to have such a huge room to transform in.

Meanwhile, the human and mid-sized monster students are walking into the building below you. Most of them notice you, and quite a few of those dash for cover. But quite a few are just looking resolutely at the ground and paying no attention to the others; the morning drudgery has that effect on people.

Recognizing one of them, you glide your head and neck over behind him and speak up. "Hello, Milesss."

Miles jumps a bit at being addressed so and turns around towards you. He's a fairly typical fringe nerd: casual dress, wiry frame to match his wiry glasses, and unwilling to put up with being insulted. He hangs out with your group at breakfast more out of convenience than any real friendship, but he's nice enough if you stay out of his bad side. With that in mind, you hold your backpack up with a limb to help him recognize you. "Don't worry, it's Alec."

"Alec? You ate those Bling donuts?" He asks, starting to walk again while turned to face you.

"Yeah. The warning came in jussst in the middle of my afternoon snack," you explain, following him through the door (and blocking it off for a while).

The two of you walk past your usual table and he looks around at the cafeteria, and you. "...There's no way you'll fit in line. Let's keep talking later."

"Fine. I'm not hungry anyway."

While Miles files in the breakfast line and you cram your coils against a wall (better get used to tight spaces now), another of your group cautiously comes over and sits down. Erik the wannabe funnyman.

"Tough crowd?"

"You could say that." He says, eying you, then finally seeing you backpack leaning against a seat. "Alec? What's being a monster like?"

"Ssstill adjusting," You respond. "Are you scared?"

He turns away from you- no, he turns towards the crowded lunchroom: On the other side, a newly transformed grey werewolf is making a spectacle of himself by slurping down a cheerleader. "Yeah, actually. You know how many people eat Bling? I don't, but it's probably a hundred times the number of monsters there used to be."

"Yeah. I'm guessing no one actually turned in the tainted donuts even if they found out in time," you respond.

Meanwhile, Miles has gotten his tray and come back. "The principal will probably call for an assembly soon and set up new rules," he says before tucking in.

"Shouldn't Rick be here by now?" You ask a bit too loudly, as if he would suddenly hear you and show up out of nowhere.

Well, it works.
